intro: Iris ruthenica var. typica, commonly known as the Siberian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It features upright, grass-like leaves and produces showy, six-petaled flowers in shades of blue, purple, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize easily. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
